Speaker: King Richard
Text: Her life is safest only in her birth.

Speaker: Marcus Brutus
Text: Prepare the body then, and follow us

Speaker: Marcus Brutus
Text: Or else were this a savage spectacle. Our reasons are so full of good regard that were you, Antony, the son of Caesar, you should be satisfied.

Speaker: Mark Antony
Text: Let each man render me his bloody hand. First, Marcus Brutus, will I shake with you; Next Caius Cassius, do I take your hand; Now Decius Brutus, yours; now yours, Metellus; Yours, Cinna; and my valiant Casca, yours; Though last, not least in love, yours, good Trebonius.

Speaker: King Richard
Text: Madam, with all my heart

Speaker: Lady MacBeth
Text: When in swinish sleep their drenched natures lies, as in a death, What cannot you and I perform upon th'unguarded Duncan?

Speaker: King Richard
Text: Even all I have- ay, and myself and all. will I withal endow a child of thine; So in the Lethe of thy angry soul Thou drown the remembrance of those wrongs which thou supposest I have done to thee.

Speaker: King Richard
Text: Upto the dignity and height of fortune, the high imperial type of this earth's glory.

Speaker: Marcus Brutus
Text: Only be patient till we have appeas’d The multitude, beside themselves with fear, And then we will deliver you the cause Why I, that did love Caesar when I struck him, Have thus proceeded.

Speaker: Marcus Brutus
Text: You shall, Mark Antony.

Speaker: King Richard
Text: What do you think?

Speaker: Mark Antony
Text: Gentlemen all—alas, what shall I say? My credit now stands on such slippery ground that one of two bad ways you must conceit me, Either a coward or a flatterer

Speaker: Mark Antony
Text: O, pardon me, thou bleeding piece of earth, that I am meek and gentle with these butchers!

Speaker: Marcus Brutus
Text: Mark Antony, here take you Caesar’s body. You shall not in your funeral speech blame us, But speak all good you can devise of Caesar, And say you do’t by our permission; Else shall you not have any hand at all About his funeral. And you shall speak In the same pulpit whereto I am going, After my speech is ended

Speaker: Phebe
Text: I’ll write to him a very taunting letter, And thou shalt bear it.

Speaker: Cassius
Text: Your voice shall be as strong as any man’s. In the disposing of new dignities.

Speaker: Phebe
Text: There be some women, Silvius, had they mark’d him In parcels as I did, would have gone near To fall in love with him; but for my part I love him not, nor hate him not; and yet Have more cause to hate him than to love him, For what had he to do to chide at me?

Speaker: King Richard
Text: Lo, at their birth good stars were opposite.

Speaker: Phebe
Text: It is a pretty youth—not very pretty— But sure he’s proud—and yet his pride becomes him.

Speaker: Mark Antony
Text: Therefore I took your hands, but was indeed Sway'd from the point, by looking down on Caesar. Friends am I with you all, and love you all, Upon this hope, that you shall give me reasons Why, and wherein, Caesar was dangerous.

Speaker: Mark Antony
Text: Domestic fury and fierce civil strife Shall cumber all the parts of Italy;

Speaker: Marcus Brutus
Text: By your pardon— I will myself into the pulpit first, And show the reason of our Caesar’s death. What Antony shall speak, I will protest He speaks by leave and by permission; And that we are contented Caesar shall Have all true rites and lawful ceremonies. It shall advantage more than do us wrong

Speaker: Lady Macduff
Text: Ay, that he was

Speaker: Lady Macduff
Text: Sirrah, your father's dead, and what will you do now? How will you live?

Speaker: Lady Macduff
Text: Now God help thee, poor monkey! But how wilt thou do for a father?

Speaker: King Richard
Text: You have a daughter called Elizabeth, virtuous and fair, royal and gracious.

Speaker: Lady MacBeth
Text: They have made themselves, and that their fitness now. Does unmake you?

Speaker: Lady MacBeth
Text: I have given suck, and know how tender 'tis to love the babe that milks me. I would, while it was smiling in my face, have plucked my nipple from his boneless gums, and dashed the brains out, had I so sworn. As you have done to this

Speaker: Lady MacBeth
Text: Who dares receive it other, as we shall make our griefs and clamour roar. Upon his death?

Speaker: Mark Antony
Text: Be it so; I do desire no more.

Speaker: Marcus Brutus
Text: Though now we must appear bloody and cruel, as by our hands and this our present act. You see we do, yet see you but our hands. And this the bleeding business they have done.

Speaker: Lady Macduff
Text: What, with worms and flies?

Speaker: Phebe
Text: Is his complexion; and faster than his tongue Did make offense, his eye did heal it up

Speaker: Lady Macduff
Text: He had none. His flight was madness.

Speaker: Lady MacBeth
Text: Know you not, he has?

Speaker: Queen Elizabeth
Text: Flatter my sorrow with report of it. Tell me, what state, what dignity, what honor. Canst thou demise to any child of mine?

Speaker: Queen Elizabeth
Text: And wilt thou learn of me?

Speaker: King Richard
Text: Who should be else

Speaker: Mark Antony
Text: A curse shall light upon the limbs of men;

Speaker: Queen Elizabeth
Text: How canst thou woo her?

Speaker: Queen Elizabeth
Text: Unless thou couldst put on some other shape and not be Richard that hath done all this.

Speaker: Queen Elizabeth
Text: So she may live unscarred of bleeding slaughter, I will confess she was not Edward's daughter.

Speaker: Queen Elizabeth
Text: To vail the title, as her mother doth.

Speaker: Phebe
Text: He said mine eyes were black and my hair black, And, now I am rememb’red, scorn’d at me.

Speaker: Phebe
Text: But that’s all one; omittance is no quittance.

Speaker: Phebe
Text: There was a pretty redness in his lip, a little riper and more lusty red than that mix’d in his cheek; ’twas just the difference betwixt the constant red and mingled damask.

Speaker: Queen Elizabeth
Text: Be brief, lest that the process of thy kindness. Last longer telling than thy kindness' date.

Speaker: Lady MacBeth
Text: He has almost supped.

Speaker: Cassius
Text: Brutus, a word with you. You know not what you do. Do not consent that Antony speak in his funeral. Know you how much the people may be mov’d by that which he will utter?

Speaker: Lady Macduff
Text: Wisdom? To leave his wife, to leave his babes,his mansion and his titles, in a place from whence himself does fly?

Speaker: Mark Antony
Text: Thou art the ruins of the noblest man that ever lived in the tide of times

Speaker: Lady MacBeth
Text: Wouldst thou have that. Which thou esteem'st the ornament of life and live a coward in thine own esteem. Letting 'I dare not', wait upon 'I would' like the poor car i'th'adage?

Speaker: Lady MacBeth
Text: But screw your courage to the sticking place and we'll not fail

Speaker: King Richard
Text: Be not so hasty to confound my meaning. I mean, that with my soul I love thy daughter, and mean to make her queen of England.

Speaker: Lady Macduff
Text: When our actions do not, our fears do make us traitors.

Speaker: Lady Macduff
Text: Thou speak'st with all thy wit, and yet, i'faith, with wit enough for thee.

Speaker: Lady MacBeth
Text: When you durst do it, then you were a man. And to be more than what you were, you would be so much more the man.

Speaker: Queen Elizabeth
Text: My daughter's mother thinks it with her soul.

Speaker: Lady Macduff
Text: Why, I can buy me twenty at any market.

Speaker: Phebe
Text: I marvel why I answer’d not again.

Speaker: Lady MacBeth
Text: When Duncan is asleep, whereto the rather shall his day's hard journey. Soundly invite him, his two chamberlains. Will I with wine and wassail so convince, that memory, the warder of the brain shall be a fume, and the receipt of reason. A limbeck only

Speaker: Mark Antony
Text: That I did love thee, Caesar, O, ’tis true; If then thy spirit look upon us now, Shall it not grieve thee dearer than thy death. To see thy Antony making his peace, Shaking the bloody fingers of thy foes, Most noble! In the presence of thy corse? Had I as many eyes as thou hast wounds, Weeping as fast as they stream forth thy blood, It would become me better than to close In terms of friendship with thine enemies. Pardon me, Julius! Here wast thou bay’d, brave hart, Here didst thou fall, and here thy hunters stand, Sign’d in thy spoil, and crimson’d in thy lethe. O world! Thou wast the forest to this hart, And this indeed, O world, the heart of thee. How like a deer, strucken by many princes, Dost thou here lie!

Speaker: Cassius
Text: I know not what may fall, I like it not.

Speaker: King Richard
Text: Th'advancement of your children, gentle lady.

Speaker: Phebe
Text: When he that speaks them pleases those that hear.

Speaker: Mark Antony
Text: That’s all I seek, And am, moreover, suitor that I may produce his body to the market-place, and in the pulpit, as becomes a friend, Speak in the order of his funeral.

Speaker: Phebe
Text: But what care I for words?

Speaker: Marcus Brutus
Text: For your part, to you our swords have leaden points, Mark Antony. Our arms in strength of malice, and our hearts of brothers’ temper, do receive you in? With all kind love, good thoughts, and reverence

Speaker: Lady Macduff
Text: How wilt thou do for a father?

Speaker: Lady Macduff
Text: why one that swears and lies

Speaker: Lady Macduff
Text: Every one that does so is a traitor, and must be hanged.

Speaker: Lady Macduff
Text: Why, the honest men.

Speaker: Mark Antony
Text: I know not, gentlemen, what you intend, who else must be let blood, who else is rank?

Speaker: Queen Elizabeth
Text: I have no more sons of the royal blood for thee to slaughter.

Speaker: King Richard
Text: Even he that makes her queen.

Speaker: Mark Antony
Text: If I myself, there is no hour so fit as Caesar's death's hour, nor no instrument of half that worth as those your swords, made rich with the most noble blood of all this world. I do beseech ye, if you bear me hard, now whilst your purpled hands do reek and smoke, fulfill your pleasure.

Speaker: Mark Antony
Text: Live a thousand years, I shall not find myself so apt to die. I defy you no place will please me so, no mean of death. As here by Caesar, and by you cut off, the choice and master spirits of this age.

Speaker: Queen Elizabeth
Text: Up to some scaffold, there to lose their heads.

Speaker: Mark Antony
Text: Blood and destruction shall be so in use, and dreadful objects so familiar, that mothers shall but smile when they behold their infants quartered with the hands of war; All pity chok’d with custom of fell deeds;

Speaker: Queen Elizabeth
Text: An honest tale speeds best being plainly told.

Speaker: King Richard
Text: Stay, madam, I must talk a word with you.

Speaker: Marcus Brutus
Text: O Antony! Beg not your death of us.

Speaker: Phebe
Text: He’ll make a proper man

Speaker: Lady Macduff
Text: What had he done, to make him fly the land?

Speaker: Queen Elizabeth
Text: But how long shall that title “ever” last?

Speaker: Queen Elizabeth
Text: But how long fairly shall her sweet life last?

Speaker: Lady MacBeth
Text: And wakes it now, to look so green and pale. At what it did so freely?

Speaker: King Richard
Text: How think you of it?

Speaker: Queen Elizabeth
Text: Well then, who dost thou mean shall be her king?

Speaker: Lady Macduff
Text: Poor bird, thou'dst never fear the net nor lime, the pitfall nor the gin.

Speaker: Lady MacBeth
Text: Why have you left the chamber?

Speaker: Cassius
Text: Mark Antony—

Speaker: Queen Elizabeth
Text: What good is cover’d with the face of heaven, to be discovered, that can do me good?

Speaker: Lady MacBeth
Text: Was the hope drunk? wherein you dressed yourself? Hath it slept since?

Speaker: Queen Elizabeth
Text: Slander myself as false to Edward's bed, throw over her the veil of infamy.

Speaker: Mark Antony
Text: And Caesar’s spirit, ranging for revenge, with Ate by his side come hot from hell, shall in these confines with a monarch’s voice Cry “Havoc!” and let slip the dogs of war, that this foul deed shall smell above the earth with carrion men, groaning for burial.

Speaker: Cassius
Text: I blame you not for praising Caesar so, But what compact mean you to have with us? Will you be prick'd in number of our friends, Or shall we on, and not depend on you?

Speaker: Lady Macduff
Text: So runs against all reason.

Speaker: Lady Macduff
Text: Yes, he is dead.

Speaker: Lady Macduff
Text: Every one.

Speaker: Lady MacBeth
Text: We fail.

Speaker: Queen Elizabeth
Text: There is no other way

Speaker: Queen Elizabeth
Text: But she, your subject, loathes such sovereignty.

Speaker: Queen Elizabeth
Text: O no, my reasons are too deep and dead. Too deep and dead, poor infants, in their graves.

Speaker: Lady MacBeth
Text: What beast was't then. That made you break this enterprise to me?

Speaker: Queen Elizabeth
Text: For my daughters, Richard, they shall be praying nuns, not weeping queens and therefore level not to hit their lives.

Speaker: Marcus Brutus
Text: Welcome, Mark Antony!

Speaker: Queen Elizabeth
Text: And must she die for this? O, let her live! And I'll corrupt her manners, stain her beauty.

Speaker: Marcus Brutus
Text: Our hearts you see not, they are pitiful. And pity to the general wrong of Rome. As fire drives out fire, so pity pity. Hath done this deed on Caesar.

Speaker: Phebe
Text: His leg is but so so—and yet ’tis well.

Speaker: Queen Elizabeth
Text: What, thou?

Speaker: Queen Elizabeth
Text: As long as hell and Richard likes of it.

Speaker: Queen Elizabeth
Text: Send to her, by the man that slew her brothers, A pair of bleeding hearts; thereon engrave “Edward” and “York.” Then haply she will weep.

Speaker: Lady Macduff
Text: Father'd he is, and yet he's fatherless.

Speaker: Queen Elizabeth
Text: And only in that safety died her brothers.

Speaker: Mark Antony
Text: O mighty Caesar! Dost thou lie so low? Are all thy conquests, glories, triumphs, spoils, shrunk to this little measure? Fare thee well!

Speaker: Phebe
Text: He is not very tall—yet for his years he’s tall.

Speaker: King Richard
Text: All unavoided is the doom of destiny

Speaker: King Richard
Text: Even so.

Speaker: Lady MacBeth
Text: From this time such I account thy love.

Speaker: Mark Antony
Text: Woe to the hand that shed this costly blood! Over thy wounds now do I prophesy (Which like dumb mouths do ope their ruby lips to beg the voice and utterance of my tongue)

Speaker: Queen Elizabeth
Text: To save her life, I'll say she is not so.

Speaker: Queen Elizabeth
Text: No, to their lives ill friends were contrary.

Speaker: Phebe
Text: ’Tis but a peevish boy—yet he talks well

Speaker: Lady MacBeth
Text: What not put upon his spongy officers, who shall bear the guilt of our great quell?

Speaker: King Richard
Text: Madam, so thrive I in my enterprise and dangerous success of bloody wars. As I intend more good to you and yours than ever you and yours by me were harmed.

Speaker: Mark Antony
Text: Pardon me, Caius Cassius! The enemies of Caesar shall say this: Then, in a friend, it is cold modesty.

Speaker: Mark Antony
Text: I doubt not of your wisdom

Speaker: Lady MacBeth
Text: Nor time nor place, did then adhere, and yet you would make both

Speaker: Queen Elizabeth
Text: Nay then indeed she cannot choose but hate thee, having bought love with such a bloody spoil.

Speaker: King Richard
Text: That would I learn of you, as one being best acquainted with her humour

Speaker: Lady Macduff
Text: He loves us not He wants the natural touch

Speaker: King Richard
Text: Know that from my soul I love thy daughter

Speaker: Lady Macduff
Text: Poor prattler, how thou talk'st!

Speaker: King Richard
Text: Wrong not her birth, she is of royal blood.

Speaker: Phebe
Text: Wilt thou, Silvius?
